Author: bumbumboleji
Text: Hi  I really get frustrated sometimes and feel like I have no idea how I look  My lower tummy is also poofy but I have nothing I can pinch on my upper tummy so idk   Maybe I kicked up or stretched out my intestines idk  Kinda feels like my upper and lower half are from two different bodies  Ugh   I see other people who I know are bigger or the same size as me and I think they look amazing  I look at myself and it’s like looking at a Picasso painting   I just resign myself to being grateful and happy that all my parts are working (eyes ok, two legs to walk ect) because I’m 36 now and I don’t ever remember looking at myself and seeing myself properly

Author: adustydragon123
Text: I have this too. All my shirts and dresses are XS and sometimes even then I’ll have to alter them to be smaller. I wear a 0 in pants and yet I don’t believe it. Even typing this out I feel a bit like a fraud and am afraid someone will call me out.   But I look in the mirror and I don’t match up with an XS, in my head at least. I feel like the sizing must just be stupidly random and inaccurate like how at every store clothes vary a bit.   When I calculate my BMI I also always feel like it must be super inaccurate because maybe it thinks I have a lot of muscle or something.   I think all of the things you described are part of the disorder. I do think I could be any weight and still think I am not thin enough and struggle to see how thin (or not?) I am.   The only time I ever thought I was thin was after I left my low weight I saw a picture from it and both thought “Holy cow I was way too thin” and “I can’t wait to get back.”
